data.message: how about #feedTheWorld... internet is not going to sustain their lives.

replies.message: There is already enough food in the world, the problem lies in distribution.

could the internet not help with distribution and spreading the word of bad things happening in parts of the world that currently most do not see or know about or even care about as they cant see it happening, i bet there are far worse personal atrocities happening in syria then the news can report, the internet could give those people a voice.

Thank you RObert for not being a moron like 99% of everyone commenting here. People do not understand the benefit of communication and knowledge. nor do they  understand the greatly heightened cost of continually importing food and building hospitals, schools, water plants, etc in these countries.
http://www.o3bnetworks.com is all I will say but oh yea this has nothing to do with share prices.

@David Longmire.. 
One dude has 18 billion dollars while every 6min a child dies of starvation and only one dollar can feed 4 for a day! WFP Students

I know a very wealthy man who donates to many charities  He came to Canada from Texas hoping for a better life.  His family was dirt poor and he was fed up with going hungry.  He made it and indulged in his first love and made a hobby out of it.  He raises some of the finest thoroughbreds in Canada and has about 200 mares in his stables.  He's lived his dream.  His only problem now at age 64 is the cancer that has attacked his body and now his wonderful wife has cancer too.  It just doesn't seem to be fair for these two people who worked their butts off has to end their life like this.

Just as a footnote, did you know that drinking a cold drink after meals can cause cancer?  This couple drink cold wine with their meals and have done so all their married life.   An article in our Calgary Herald explained how that happens.
